articles.title: The New Math of Quantum Cryptography
articles.description: In theory, quantum physics can bypass the hard mathematical problems at the root of modern encryption. A new proof shows how.

articles.title: What is Redis Cache ?
articles.description: Redis is an open-source, in-memory data store and database known for its lightning-fast performance, versatility, and support for a wide range of use cases in modern application development. By functioning as both a cache and a NoSQL key-value database, Redis enables developers to deliver applicatio
articles.content: Redis is an open-source, in-memory data store and database known for its lightning-fast performance, versatility, and support for a wide range of use cases in modern application development. By functioning as both a cache and a NoSQL key-value database, Redis enables developers to deliver applications with extremely low latency and high scalability‚Äîmaking it a foundational technology for systems that require real-time data processing, efficient caching, and rapid data access. Understanding Redis
articles.author: Satyabrata

articles.title: ‚ÄúFirst of its kind‚Äù AI settlement: Anthropic to pay authors $1.5 billion
articles.description: Settlement shows AI companies can face consequences for pirated training data.
articles.content: Authors revealed today that Anthropic agreed to pay $1.5 billion and destroy all copies of the books the AI company pirated to train its artificial intelligence models. In a press release provided to Ars, the authors confirmed that the settlement is "believed to be the largest publicly reported recovery in the history of US copyright litigation." Covering 500,000 works that Anthropic pirated for AI training, if a court approves the settlement, each author will receive $3,000 per work that Anthro

articles.title: Wake Up Dead Man adds a delightfully dark twist to Knives Out
articles.description: When director Rian Johnson introduced the new Knives Out film on the third day of TIFF 2025, he exclaimed: "we're going back to church." By that he meant that Wake Up Dead Man, the latest Benoit Blanc mystery, would harken back to the origins of the whodunit, and in particular the gothic vibes of Ed
articles.content: When director Rian Johnson introduced the new Knives Out film on the third day of TIFF 2025, he exclaimed: "we're going back to church." By that he meant that Wake Up Dead Man , the latest Benoit Blanc mystery, would harken back to the origins of the whodunit, and in particular the gothic vibes of Edgar Allan Poe. And now that I've seen it, I have to say that Johnson pulled it off: the new movie has a darker and more spiritual feel than its predecessors, and yet it's still distinctly Knives Out
articles.author: Andrew Webster

articles.content: In less than 48 hours, Apple will finally begin its big September "Awe dropping" iPhone event , and we'll get our official look at the long-anticipated iPhone 17 lineup. articles.content: We're now just days away from the Apple's September 9 event, where the company is all but certain to unveil the iPhone 17 line. This year's theme of "Awe dropping," which was featured in Apple's invitations to the media sent on August 26 doesn't reveal much by way of clues, though some think the heat-mapped Apple logo is indicative of better thermal cooling in the new models. But more importantly, we already know how to watch the Apple iPhone 17 event itself: The keynote will

articles.title: GOP may finally succeed in unrelenting quest to kill two NASA climate satellites
articles.description: One scientist says it's like buying a car and running it into a tree to save on gas money.
articles.content: It was in 2002, during the George W. Bush administration, when NASA decided to put a satellite into orbit to track emissions of carbon dioxide, the primary greenhouse gas pumped into the atmosphere through human activity. After many twists and turns, NASA's 23-year remit of charting greenhouse gas emissions could come to a close as soon as the end of this month. President Donald Trump's budget request to Congress calls for terminating 41 of NASA's 124 science missions in development or operation
articles.author: Stephen Clark

The site was known for selling devices that allowed users to get around Nintendo's pi
articles.content: Nintendo has just won another major battle in its longstanding war against piracy . Earlier this summer, a US federal court ruled in favor of Nintendo in a lawsuit against Ryan Daly and the Modded Hardware website. The site was known for selling devices that allowed users to get around Nintendo's piracy protections, including the popular MIG Switch flashcart that lets buyers play official Nintendo games without the need for a physical cartridge. Besides requiring Daly to pay $2 million to Ninten

articles.title: "useMemoization" in reactjs
articles.description: Memoization in React is an optimization technique used to prevent unnecessary re-renders of components or re-calculations of expensive values. It works by caching the result of a function or component based on its inputs (props or dependencies) and returning the cached result if the inputs haven't c
articles.content: Memoization in React is an optimization technique used to prevent unnecessary re-renders of components or re-calculations of expensive values. It works by caching the result of a function or component based on its inputs (props or dependencies) and returning the cached result if the inputs haven't changed. 1. Memoizing Components with React.memo: React.memo is a higher-order component (HOC) used to memoize functional components. It prevents the component from re-rendering if its props have not c

articles.title: GM slows EV production as tax credit nears expiration
articles.description: General Motors is going to be scaling back production of the Cadillac Lyriq and Vistiq, as well as the Chevy Bolt EV as it expects sales of electric vehicles to slow dramatically. The $7,500 consumer tax credit for purchasing a new EV is set to expire at the end of the month. That credit has [&#8230
articles.content: General Motors is going to be scaling back production of the Cadillac Lyriq and Vistiq, as well as the Chevy Bolt EV as it expects sales of electric vehicles to slow dramatically. The $7,500 consumer tax credit for purchasing a new EV is set to expire at the end of the month. That credit has been crucial to driving demand for EVs, which are still more expensive than their gas-powered counterparts. The company is pausing production on the Lyriq and Vistiq at its Spring Hill, Tennessee plant in De
articles.author: Terrence O‚ÄôBrien

articles.description: Everyone basically agrees: if you want people to transition from polluting gas guzzlers to electric cars, you have to make them more affordable. The luxury EVs, with their big battery packs and fine leather interiors, are all well and good, but if you really want to move the needle on EV adoption, w
articles.content: Everyone basically agrees: if you want people to transition from polluting gas guzzlers to electric cars, you have to make them more affordable. The luxury EVs, with their big battery packs and fine leather interiors, are all well and good, but if you really want to move the needle on EV adoption, we need more entry-level options. And so far, we‚Äôre lacking. Volkswagen hears this, and is responding with a new lineup of small and mid-sized electric vehicles aimed squarely at the low end of the mar
articles.author: Andrew J. Hawkins

articles.description: The new 911 variant is 14 seconds quicker around the N√ºrburgring Nordschleife.
articles.content: Today, Porsche debuted a new 911 variant at the IAA Mobility show in Munich, Germany. It's the most powerful 911 to date, excluding some limited-run models, and may well be the quickest to 60 mph from a standing start, dispatching that dash in just 2.4 seconds. And it's all thanks to one of the most interesting hybrid powertrains on sale today. Rather than just bolting an electric motor to an existing 911, Porsche designed an entirely new 3.6 L flat-six engine, taking the opportunity to ditch th
articles.author: Jonathan M. Gitlin

articles.content: The Toronto International Film Festival is almost like a preview of the movie slate for the next few months ‚Äî and this year I’m watching as much as possible to give you all the scoop on what’s ahead. articles.content: For most Hollow Knight: Silksong players, the combat is challenging and the boss fights are punishing. However, there's another layer of complexity for anyone playing the sequel in Simplified Chinese: the bizarre translations. On its Steam store page , Silksong currently sits at a "Mostly Positive" rating across reviews in all languages. articles.title: Who can get a COVID vaccine‚Äîand how? It‚Äôs complicated.
articles.description: We‚Äôre working with a patchwork system, and there are a lot of gray areas.
articles.content: As fall approaches and COVID cases tick up, you might be thinking about getting this season's COVID-19 vaccine. The annually updated shots have previously been easily accessible to anyone over 6 months of age. Most people could get them at no cost by simply walking into their neighborhood pharmacy‚Äîand that's what most people did. However, the situation is much different this year with an ardent anti-vaccine activist, Robert F. Kennedy Jr., as the country's top health official. Since taking the r
articles.author: Beth Mole
